dataset_info.name: Insurance Cost of Care Classification
dataset_info.description: Classify patients into insurance cost categories (Low, Medium, High, Critical) based on health and demographic factors for insurance premium planning
dataset_info.target_description: 0 = Low Cost (<$2k/year), 1 = Medium Cost ($2k-$8k/year), 2 = High Cost ($8k-$20k/year), 3 = Critical Cost (>$20k/year)
dataset_info.use_case: Insurance premium calculation, risk assessment, policy underwriting, and actuarial analysis

data_dictionary.chronic_conditions_count: Number of chronic health conditions (diabetes, hypertension, etc.)
data_dictionary.exercise_frequency_per_week: Number of exercise sessions per week
data_dictionary.family_medical_history_score: Family health history risk score 1-10 (10=high risk)
data_dictionary.previous_claims_count: Number of insurance claims in past 3 years
data_dictionary.mental_health_score: Mental health assessment score 1-10 (10=excellent mental health)

0_low_cost.description: Healthy individuals with minimal healthcare needs
0_low_cost.typical_profile: Young, healthy, active lifestyle, no chronic conditions

1_medium_cost.description: Generally healthy with occasional medical needs
1_medium_cost.typical_profile: Middle-aged, minor health issues, preventive care

2_high_cost.description: Individuals with chronic conditions requiring regular care
2_high_cost.typical_profile: Chronic diseases, regular medications, specialist visits

3_critical_cost.description: Complex medical conditions requiring intensive care

business_applications.premium_calculation: Set appropriate insurance premiums based on predicted cost category
business_applications.risk_underwriting: Accept/reject insurance applications based on risk assessment
business_applications.policy_customization: Tailor coverage options to predicted cost categories
business_applications.actuarial_analysis: Improve actuarial models with better risk classification
business_applications.preventive_programs: Target high-risk individuals for wellness programs
business_applications.claim_reserves: Set aside appropriate reserves for different risk categories

preprocessing_notes.normalization: Normalize age, BMI, and count variables
preprocessing_notes.class_imbalance: Monitor for class imbalance in larger datasets
preprocessing_notes.outlier_detection: Check for extreme BMI values or unrealistic claim counts

usage_example.python_code:
import json
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from tensorflow.keras.utils import to_categorical
from sklearn.metrics import classification_report, confusion_matrix

# Load data
with open('insurance_cost_classification.json', 'r') as f:
    dataset = json.load(f)

# Convert to DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(dataset['data'])

# Feature engineering
df['health_risk_score'] = (df['chronic_conditions_count'] * 2 + 
                           df['smoker'] * 3 + 
                           (10 - df['exercise_frequency_per_week']) +
                           df['family_medical_history_score'])

# Separate features and target
features = dataset['features'] + ['health_risk_score']
X = df[features]
y = df['cost_category']

# One-hot encode target for multi-class
y_categorical = to_categorical(y, num_classes=4)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)

# Train-test split
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X_scaled, y_categorical, test_size=0.2, random_state=42, stratify=y)
usage_example.model_architecture: Input(11) → Dense(128, ReLU) → Dropout(0.3) → Dense(64, ReLU) → Dropout(0.2) → Dense(32, ReLU) → Dense(4, Softmax)
usage_example.metrics: Accuracy, Precision, Recall, F1-score per class, Confusion Matrix
usage_example.class_weights: Consider using class weights if dataset becomes imbalanced

model_interpretability.feature_importance: Identify which factors most influence cost category predictions
model_interpretability.shap_analysis: Use SHAP values to explain individual predictions to underwriters
model_interpretability.decision_boundaries: Visualize how the model separates different cost categories
model_interpretability.confidence_scores: Provide prediction confidence for borderline cases

regulatory_considerations.fairness: Ensure model doesn't discriminate based on protected characteristics
regulatory_considerations.transparency: Maintain explainable predictions for regulatory compliance
regulatory_considerations.data_privacy: Comply with healthcare data privacy regulations (HIPAA)
regulatory_considerations.actuarial_standards: Align with actuarial principles and industry standards
regulatory_considerations.bias_monitoring: Regularly audit model for bias against protected groups

validation_strategy.cross_validation: Use stratified k-fold to maintain class balance
validation_strategy.temporal_validation: If temporal data available, use time-based splits
validation_strategy.business_validation: Validate predictions against actual claims experience
validation_strategy.sensitivity_analysis: Test model robustness to changes in key features
validation_strategy.a_b_testing: Compare model predictions to current underwriting decisions
